title.narrative: # of political/civic actors taken measures enhancing representation of women and youth

description.narrative: # of political/civic actors taken measures enhancing representation of women and youth

comment.narrative: Party women and youth Quotas – 1 (Frelimo formalized and implemented), 2 (Renamo and MDM, not formalized and with weak implementation) Civil society campaigns for Zebra lists (alternation of women and men as candidates in party electoral lists)

During the two sessions of the dialogue platforms, the leaders of the women's leagues of the 3 parliamentary parties (Frelimo, Renamo e MDM), publicly issued positions advocating for the increase in the quantity and quality of the presence of women in political parties and in elected democratic institutions.

title.narrative: 3.2 Political and civic actors build trust
3.2 Political and civic actors build trust

description.narrative: 3.2 Political and civic actors build trust to enable alliances across political divides
3.2 Political and civic actors build trust to enable alliances across political divides

title.narrative: # of interparty dialogue meetings (at national level)

description.narrative: # of interparty dialogue meetings (at national level)

comment.narrative: In the meeting between the diplomats and women’sleagues of the three parliamentary parties – Frelimo, Renamo and MDM, it was suggested that these organizations should meet regularly and even create a platform to promote women’s rights and participation in politics. This can be on perennial form of an interparty dialogue.

The meeting was attended by 90 people from several parties and CSO´s, had as immediate results the capture of the main challenges that influence the active participation of young people in political parties and governance, namely: • Feeling of social exclusion of young people who do not belong to the ruling party. • Reduced access to resources when there is no political influence. • Reduced almost non-existent power of influence in political parties. Participants (women, youth and civil society) came up with tangible solutions, such as: • Adoption of the quota system in the lists presented by political parties should be a priority in the next review of electoral legislation. • Create a predisposition in young people to actively participate in politics, which in part can be fought through teaching programs that contain political content. • Reinforce the capacity building of young people so that they are equipped with the capacity and tools capable of enabling them to better contribute to elected parties and institutions.

During the year, it is expected to hold meetings with multi-actors. Part of these meetings will be with parliamentary and extra-parliamentary political parties (interparty dialogue sessions) to advocate and lobby for the objectives of the PoD program. Despite the limitations resulting from the pandemic, it is expected to hold at least 3 meetings in 2021.

Despite the limitations resulting from the pandemic, it is expected to hold at least 3 meetings in 2021.

title.narrative: # of L&A activities for making the political system more inclusive (in relation to women / youth / minority groups) at national level

description.narrative: # of L&A activities for making the political system more inclusive (in relation to women / youth / minority groups) at national level

comment.narrative: There have been multiple initiatives throughout the history to promote the participation of these groups and IMD has also promoted several interventions with this objective. However, it is necessary to seek some differential to capture results and changes in actors and in the political system, so that they are not just actions without effect.

During 2021, 3 advocacy initiatives were carried out. Of these, 1 was informal and 2 were informal. Since the implementation of the SP program, it has been noted that the informal approach to the actors is more effective than the formal one because it allows them to be sensitized bilaterally and establish a "friendship" link.

It is expected that during 2021, at least 4 formal interventions will be carried out. In the meantime, several other informal lobbying initiatives will take place close to key actors and social and political influencers for the program.

title.narrative: # of multi-stakeholder dialogue meetings (at national level)

description.narrative: # of multi-stakeholder dialogue meetings (at national level)

comment.narrative: In September 2021 the IMD, through the Political Academy for Women in partnership with the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands, organized a forum for dialogue, in which women from the women's leagues and diplomatic entities discussed the main challenges of women's political participation in different political contexts. These debates are very important but do not necessarily or directly lead to a substantial shift in policy influence. For diplomats and development partners to influence decision-making, they need to be present and have influence in key decision-making arenas such as parliament and government, and most importantly, influence decisions within political parties. Another arena of influence is through supporting the various development programs, especially those that act at the community level and deal with social rights and norms, as it is at the base where the foundations of the marginalization of women and young people are and end up influencing. organizational and political culture at higher levels.

1 (one) intervention, which consisted of a dialogue session that brought together 3 stakeholders: young aspiring politicians, young people and women from the leagues of parliamentary and extra-parliamentary political parties, civil society, MP´s. The event aimed to create a space for dialogue so that youth and women from the leagues, civil society and elected political actors could discuss and seek consensus in terms of tangible actions that could contribute to the improvement of the qualitative and quantitative participation of women, allowing the women to influence and participate in legitimate, transparent and accountable political processes

In the context of implementing the PoD Program, it is expected to hold at least 3 meetings at national level during the year 2021, in which representatives of civil society organizations, political actors, diplomatic entities, religious leaders and Members of Parliament will participate.
